conclusion: The problem involves finding the maximum electromotive force (EMF) generated by a rotating-armature AC generator with given parameters.

Figure (A) shows a schematic diagram of an AC generator with a rectangular coil rotating uniformly around a fixed axis perpendicular to the magnetic field. Figure (Z) shows the sinusoidal variation of magnetic flux through the coil over time.
The coil has 100 turns (m=100), resistance r=10Ω, and is connected to a resistor R=90Ω via slip rings. An ideal AC voltmeter is connected in parallel with R.
At time t=0, the plane of the coil is parallel to the magnetic field direction, and the magnetic flux through each turn varies sinusoidally with time.
The EMF generated by the coil is proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux through each turn of the coil.
The magnetic flux Φ through each turn is given by Φ = B · A · sin(ωt), where B is the magnetic flux density, A is the area of the coil, and ω is the angular frequency.
The area A of the coil can be expressed as A = πr², where r is the radius of the coil.
The maximum magnetic flux Φ₀ is given by Φ₀ = B · A = B · πr².
